subject: Economy
question_en: What is the concept of National Income?
explanation_en: Net National Product (NNP) refers to the value of all goods and services produced in a country after deducting the depreciation of capital goods. It is a measure of a country's economic productivity. In contrast, Gross National Product (GNP) includes the value of goods and services produced both within the country and abroad, including remittances from abroad. Factor Product (FP) includes only the value of goods and services produced within the country using country's factors of production, such as labor and capital. Net National Product (NNP) is a more accurate measure of a country's economic performance.

In contrast, Gross National Product (GNP) includes the value of goods and services produced both within the country and abroad, including remittances from abroad. Factor Product (FP) includes only the value of goods and services produced within the country using the country's factors of production, such as labor and capital. Net National Product (NNP) is a more accurate measure of a country's economic performance.
